divs: Sighting DetailsI have been observing an object at 9:30 P.M. last night that I would describe being similar to a very bright star for almost three months on a regular basis nightly. I went out to look at the night sky and looked up at the stars when I saw a very bright object to my South South East direction from my home. It really stood out from the stars because of the intense brightness. I watched the object slowly move in unpredictable patterns. It was hard to judge the distance and altitude being at night. I went back into the house to get my bincoulars. When I looked through them I could just make out a red colored ring pulsating and moving in a circular motion. When I pulled the binoculars down and looked at it with my eyes; it suddenly dimmed itself slowly and disappeared. I went back into my house wondering what in the world I just witnessed. I went back out maybe 45 mins. later and observed it back in it's original spot I had seen it earlier. It made no sound at all and definately wasn't an airplane, helicopter, weather ballon, or any swamp gas! I have served 23 yrs. in Army National Guard so far and have never seen any equipment with this technology to do the things this object did in the sky. I thought about calling the local authorities here and seeing if any other reports possibly came in from any area residents; but changed my mind.
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
trends: There has been one other sighting in Runnelstown
There were no other sightings in Runnelstown on or around July 23rd 2008
